We are using remoting scenario two with our remote objects hosted in IIS. When constructing the URI to call on the client, if no uri attribute is specified it uses the baseUri + componentId, if uri is specified it uses the specified uri
The problem is that the convention for remote objects (at least using the http channel) is .rem so IIS can route the request to ASP.NET We have to either specify a full uri per component (including hostname) or give our components an id with a suffix ie .rem
Specifying the hostname in every component isn't cool and we use a custom naming system so we can't add '.rem' to the component name in the config. I suggest if componentId is used that is concatted with '.rem' or add another attribute to the config that lets us specify the file portion of the uri only.
